name: No Game No Life
description:
Let's consider the following game of Alice and Bob on a directed acyclic
graph. Each vertex may contain an arbitrary number of chips. Alice and Bob
make turns alternating. Alice goes first. In one turn player can move exactly
one chip along any edge outgoing from the vertex that contains this chip to
the end of this edge. The one who cannot make a turn loses. Both players play
optimally. Consider the following process that takes place every second on a
given graph with 
    n
 vertices: An integer 
    v
 is chosen equiprobably
from 
    [1, n + 1]
. If 
    v 
    ≤ n
, we add a chip to the 
    v
-th
vertex and go back to step 1. If 
    v = n + 1
, Alice and Bob play the game
with the current arrangement of chips and the winner is determined. After
that, the process is terminated. Find the probability that Alice will win the
game. It can be shown that the answer can be represented as

    P/Q
, where 
    P
 and 
    Q
 are coprime integers and 
    Q
    
    ≡ 0 
    998
     244
     353
. Print the value of 
    P
    
    · Q^-1
     998
     244
     353
. Input The first line contains two
integers 
    n
 and 
    m
 — the number of vertices and edges of the graph
(
    1 
    ≤ n 
    ≤ 10^5
, 
    0 
    ≤ m 
    ≤ 10^5
). The following

    m
 lines contain edges description. The 
    i
-th of them contains two
integers 
    u_i
 and 
    v_i
 — the beginning and the end vertices of the

    i
-th edge (
    1 
    ≤ u_i, v_i 
    ≤ n
). It's guaranteed that the
graph is acyclic. Output Output a single integer — the probability of Alice
victory modulo 
    998
     244
     353
. Examples Input 1 0 Output 0 Input 2 1
1 2 Output 332748118 Input 5 5 1 4 5 2 4 3 1 5 5 4 Output 931694730
